intro: Crucianella angustifolia var. chabertii, commonly known as the narrow-leaved crucianella, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Plantaginaceae and is characterized by its small, narrow leaves and clusters of pale blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, calcareous soils and is often found in wetlands or along riverbanks. It is a herbaceous perennial that produces small, capsule-like fruits containing numerous seeds. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species in many areas.
